sub_topic: Determining the type of bond between two atoms
message_1: What type of bond exists between a calcium ion (Ca²⁺) and a chlorine ion (Cl⁻) in calcium chloride (CaCl₂)?
message_2: The type of bond that exists between a calcium ion (Ca²⁺) and a chlorine ion (Cl⁻) in calcium chloride (CaCl₂) is an ionic bond. This bond is formed due to the electrostatic attraction between the positively charged calcium ion and the negatively charged chlorine ions.
